body:
Build error/ First error is missing libsodium! After `sudo apt-get install libsodium-dev;`  next error is:


```
user@ubuntu:~/c-toxcore-0.2.8/_build$ make

make: *** [all] Error 2
```

comment_data.body: Do a clean build. Remove `_build`, create it again and run the cmake and make commands.
I also encountered the same problem, is it solved?
You are missing libsodium, install it.

I tried `sudo apt-get install libsodium-dev` and also tried to compile and install `libsodium` directly, but that didn't help.

In fact, I just want to write a simple chat robot with it. Are there any Pre-built binaries versions for Ubuntu? The link to [tox.chat's package repository](https://tox.chat/download.html#gnulinux) in INSTALL.md didn't work.

```
[ 83%] Building C object CMakeFiles/toxcore_shared.dir/toxcore/Messenger.c.o
[ 84%] Building C object CMakeFiles/toxcore_shared.dir/toxcore/group.c.o
[ 86%] Building C object CMakeFiles/toxcore_shared.dir/toxcore/tox_api.c.o
[ 88%] Building C object CMakeFiles/toxcore_shared.dir/toxcore/tox.c.o

[ 91%] Built target toxcore_shared

[ 98%] Building C object CMakeFiles/DHT_bootstrap.dir/other/bootstrap_node_packets.c.o
[100%] Linking C executable DHT_bootstrap
libtoxcore.a(network.c.o)：在函数‘networking_at_startup’中：
network.c:(.text+0xe1d)：对‘sodium_init’未定义的引用
libtoxcore.a(crypto_core.c.o)：在函数‘public_key_cmp’中：
crypto_core.c:(.text+0x72)：对‘crypto_verify_32’未定义的引用
libtoxcore.a(crypto_core.c.o)：在函数‘encrypt_precompute’中：
crypto_core.c:(.text+0x1cb)：对‘crypto_box_beforenm’未定义的引用
libtoxcore.a(crypto_core.c.o)：在函数‘encrypt_data_symmetric’中：
crypto_core.c:(.text+0x2e6)：对‘crypto_box_afternm’未定义的引用
libtoxcore.a(crypto_core.c.o)：在函数‘decrypt_data_symmetric’中：
crypto_core.c:(.text+0x47e)：对‘crypto_box_open_afternm’未定义的引用
libtoxcore.a(crypto_core.c.o)：在函数‘crypto_new_keypair’中：
crypto_core.c:(.text+0x828)：对‘crypto_box_keypair’未定义的引用
libtoxcore.a(crypto_core.c.o)：在函数‘crypto_derive_public_key’中：
crypto_core.c:(.text+0x84d)：对‘crypto_scalarmult_curve25519_base’未定义的引用
libtoxcore.a(crypto_core.c.o)：在函数‘crypto_sha256’中：
crypto_core.c:(.text+0x87b)：对‘crypto_hash_sha256’未定义的引用
libtoxcore.a(crypto_core.c.o)：在函数‘crypto_sha512’中：
crypto_core.c:(.text+0x8a9)：对‘crypto_hash_sha512’未定义的引用

crypto_core.c:(.text+0x8cf)：对‘randombytes’未定义的引用

crypto_core_mem.c:(.text+0x1f)：对‘sodium_memzero’未定义的引用
libtoxcore.a(crypto_core_mem.c.o)：在函数‘crypto_memcmp’中：
crypto_core_mem.c:(.text+0x4d)：对‘sodium_memcmp’未定义的引用
libmisc_tools.a(misc_tools.c.o)：在函数‘use_test_rng’中：
misc_tools.c:(.text+0x6f2)：对‘randombytes_set_implementation’未定义的引用
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
CMakeFiles/DHT_bootstrap.dir/build.make:125: recipe for target 'DHT_bootstrap' failed
make[2]: *** [DHT_bootstrap] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:1043: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/DHT_bootstrap.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/DHT_bootstrap.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:140: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2
```
Hm, perhaps you don't have `pkg-config` installed then, cmake uses it for finding dependencies like libsodium, which would explain why libsodium is not getting linked.
Speaking of binary packages, [toxcore is packaged in Ubuntu 18.10 and 19.04](https://packages.ubuntu.com/search?suite=all&searchon=names&keywords=toxcore).

Closing the issue since the original poster hasn't replied anything in a while, the issue is not reproducible on my machine and CI configurations, and @zerofancy seems to have gotten his issue resolved judging by the thumbs-up.
For Fedora 31, I also set "export PKG_CONFIG_PATH=/usr/local/lib/pkgconfig" where libsodium is installed.  A reference here https://people.freedesktop.org/~dbn/pkg-config-guide.html.

@Joey5460 `/usr/local` is for self-built software, not for distro-packaged, so that's not Fedora's libsodium you have in there. pkg-config doesn't look in `/usr/local` by default. Obviously, if you have toxcore dependencies installed all over your system, you need to tell pkg-config where to look for them in order to build toxcore, which is done using `PKG_CONFIG_*` env variables.

title: build error
